title: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: 200g spaghetti, 100g pancetta, 2 large eggs, 50g Pecorino cheese, 50g Parmesan, 2 plump garlic cloves, 50g unsalted butter, sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: 1. Put a large saucepan of water on to boil. 2. Finely chop the pancetta, having first removed any rind. 3. Finely grate both cheeses and mix them together. 4. Beat the eggs in a medium bowl, season with a little freshly grated black pepper and set everything aside. 5. Add 1 tsp salt to the boiling water, add the spaghetti and when the water comes back to the boil, cook at a constant simmer, covered, for 10 minutes or until al dente (just cooked). 6. Squash the garlic with the blade of a knife, just to bruise it. 7. While the spaghetti is cooking, fry the pancetta with the garlic. 8. Drop the butter into the pan and, when melted, remove from the heat and discard the garlic. 9. Save some of the pasta water and drain the spaghetti. 10. Quickly put the pasta into the pan with the pancetta. 11. Mix most of the cheese in with the eggs, keeping a small handful back for sprinkling over later. 12. Take the pan of spaghetti and pancetta off the heat. 13. Quickly pour in the eggs and cheese. 14. Using the tongs or a long fork, lift up the spaghetti so it mixes easily with the egg mixture, which thickens but doesn’t scramble, and everything is coated. 15. Add extra pasta cooking water to keep it saucy. 16. Season with a little salt, if needed. 17. Use a long-pronged fork to twist the pasta on to the serving plate or into a bowl. 18. Serve immediately with a little sprinkling of the remaining cheese and a grating of black pepper.

title: Chicken Curry
ingredients: 500g chicken breast, 2 onions, 3 garlic cloves, 1 tbsp ginger, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp chili powder, 400g canned tomatoes, 200ml coconut milk, salt, pepper, fresh coriander
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. 2. Add chopped onions and cook until golden. 3. Add minced garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute. 4. Add turmeric, cumin, coriander, and chili powder and cook for 2 minutes. 5. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned. 6. Add canned tomatoes and coconut milk, bring to a boil. 7. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. 8. Season with salt and pepper. 9. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
ingredients: 1 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 onion, 2 garlic cloves, 1 red bell pepper, 1 yellow bell pepper, 1 broccoli, 2 carrots, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 2 tbsp water, salt, pepper
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a large wok over high heat. 2. Add sliced onion and minced garlic, stir-fry for 1 minute. 3. Add sliced bell peppers, broccoli florets, and julienned carrots, stir-fry for 5 minutes. 4. Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, and water in a small bowl. 5. Pour the sauce into the wok and stir-fry for another 2 minutes until vegetables are coated and sauce has thickened. 6. Season with salt and pepper. 7. Serve hot with rice or noodles.

title: Pancakes
ingredients: 200g flour, 300ml milk, 2 eggs, 1 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt, butter for cooking
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. 2. In another bowl, whisk milk and eggs together. 3. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. 4. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a small amount of butter. 5. Pour batter onto the pan and cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown. 6. Serve with syrup, fruits, or your favorite toppings.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 200g butter, 150g sugar, 150g brown sugar, 2 eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 300g flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 200g chocolate chips
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). 2. In a bowl, cream together butter, sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. 3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. 4. Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; gradually blend into the creamed mixture. 5. Stir in the chocolate chips. 6. Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased pans. 7. Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are nicely browned. 8. Cool on wire racks.
